intro: Newcastelia insignis, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to deep pink. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in rocky or alpine environments. It thrives in cool, humid conditions and is adapted to high-altitude ecosystems. Newcastelia insignis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
